title: Immune-Related Adverse Events for GI Toxicity - Hepatitis
desc: The Immune-Related Adverse Events for GI Toxicity - Hepatitis grades severity of hepatitis secondary to immune checkpoint inhibitor therapy.

orgreference.text: Brahmer JR, Lacchetti C, Schneider BJ, et al. Management of Immune-Related Adverse Events in Patients Treated With Immune Checkpoint Inhibitor Therapy: American Society of Clinical Oncology Clinical Practice Guideline. J Clin Oncol. 2018;36(17):1714-1768.

data.evidence:
Criteria

Hepatitis grade

Asymptomatic (AST or ALT > ULN to 3.0 x ULN and/or total bilirubin > ULN to 1.5 x ULN)

G1

Asymptomatic (AST or ALT > ULN to 3.0 to 5 x ULN and/or total bilirubin >1.5 to ≤3 x ULN)

G2

Symptomatic liver dysfunction, fibrosis by biopsy, compensated cirrhosis, reactivation of chronic hepatitis (AST or ALT 5-20 x ULN and/or total bilirubin 3-10 x ULN) 

G3

Decompensated liver function leg, ascites, coagulopathy, encephalopathy, coma; AST or ALT >20 x ULN and/or total bilirubin >10 x ULN)

G4

See Next Steps for details on management.
